name: South of the Border Shrimp and Grits
author: thedailygourmet
summary: This shrimp and grits can usually be made with on-hand ingredients. The best part...it's ready in under 30 minutes.
ingredients: ⅓ cup grated sharp Cheddar cheese
⅓ pound frozen medium shrimp - thawed, shelled, and deveined
2 teaspoons hot sauce, or to taste  (Optional)
directions: Combine evaporated milk, grits, chicken broth, and butter in a saucepan over medium-high heat; bring to a boil
Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened, 5 to 7 minutes
Add Cheddar cheese and stir until incorporated
Remove from the heat and set aside
Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until crisp and browned, about 3 minutes per side
Drain bacon slices on paper towels and chop when cool enough to handle
Add bell peppers to the bacon grease
Cook and stir until peppers are heated through and shrimp are bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, 3 to 5 minutes
Place a dollop of grits in each bowl and top with shrimp mixture and hot sauce
